The library wing was first conceived merely as (i) _________ to address the problem of book overstock until a more permanent solution could be found. Ironically, it was the flimsy nature of the wing itself that attracted such architectural interest and ultimately led to its canonization as a (ii) _________ of its kind. Now a statute exists to protect this originally transient structure in (iii) _________.
Blank (i)
Blank (ii)
Blank (iii)
(A) a stopgap
(D) paragon
(G) consecration
(B) an ornament
(E) nadir
(H) chronology
(C) a modicum
(F) catalyst
(I) perpetuity
